ChallengeDepositWithdrawn(uint256,addres.details: This event indicates that the challenge deposit has been withdrawn.

params._challenger: The recipient of the challenge deposit.
params._epoch: The epoch associated with the batch.

ChallengeDepositWithdrawnTimeout(uint256.details: This event indicates that the challenge deposit has been withdrawn.

params._challenger: The recipient of the challenge deposit.
params._epoch: The epoch associated with the batch.

Challenged(uint256).details: This event indicates that `sendSafeFallback()` should be called on the sending side.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the challenged claim.

ClaimDepositWithdrawn(uint256,address).details: This event indicates that the claim deposit has been withdrawn.

params._bridger: The recipient of the claim deposit.
params._epoch: The epoch associated with the batch.

ClaimDepositWithdrawnTimeout(uint256,add.details: This event indicates that the claim deposit has been withdrawn.

params._bridger: The recipient of the claim deposit.
params._epoch: The epoch associated with the batch.

Claimed(uint256,bytes32).details: The Fast Bridge participants watch for these events to decide if a challenge should be submitted.

params._batchMerkleRoot: The timestamp of the claim creation.
params._epoch: The epoch for which the the claim was made.

MessageRelayed(uint256).details: This event indicates that a message has been relayed for the batch in this `_epoch`.

params._nonce: The nonce of the message that was relayed.

Verified(uint256).details: This events indicates that optimistic verification has succeeded. The messages are ready to be relayed.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the batch.

challenge(uint256).details: Submit a challenge for the claim of the current epoch's Fast Bridge batch merkleroot state and submit a deposit. The `batchMerkleRoot` in the claim already made for the last finalized epoch should be different from the one on the sending side, otherwise the sender will lose his deposit.

params._epoch: The epoch of the claim to challenge.

claim(uint256,bytes32).details: Submit a claim about the the _stateroot at _epoch and submit a deposit.

params._challengePeriod: The duration of the period allowing to challenge a claim.
params._deposit: The deposit amount to submit a claim in wei.
params._epochClaimWindow: The number of epochs a claim can be submitted for.
params._inbox: The address of the inbox contract on Ethereum.
params._numEpochTimeout: The number of epochs after which the bridge is considered to be frozen.
params._veaInbox: The address of the inbox contract on Ethereum.

resolveChallenge(uint256,bytes32).details: Resolves any challenge of the optimistic claim for '_epoch'.

params._stateRoot: The true batch merkle root for the epoch.

params._proof: The merkle proof to prove the message.

params._epoch: The epoch of the optimistic claim.

withdrawChallengeDeposit(uint256).details: Sends the deposit back to the Challenger if their challenge is successful. Includes a portion of the Bridger's deposit.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the challenge deposit to withraw.

withdrawChallengeDepositTimeout(uint256).details: Sends the deposit back to the Challenger if their challenge is successful. Includes a portion of the Bridger's deposit.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the challenge deposit to withraw.

withdrawClaimDeposit(uint256).details: Sends the deposit back to the Bridger if their claim is not successfully challenged. Includes a portion of the Challenger's deposit if unsuccessfully challenged.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the claim deposit to withraw.

withdrawClaimDepositTimeout(uint256).details: Sends the deposit back to the Bridger if their claim is not successfully challenged. Includes a portion of the Challenger's deposit if unsuccessfully challenged.

params._epoch: The epoch associated with the claim deposit to withraw.

resolveChallenge(uint256,bytes32).notice: Note: Access restricted to arbitrum canonical bridge.

userdoc.notice: Vea Bridge Outbox On L1 Ethereum
